info.title: Ingest Profiles API Reference
info.description: Reference for the Brightcove Ingest Profiles API, used to create and manage ingest profiles that specify video and image renditions to be created, along with instructions for archiving masters. To test API requests, you can use our API Testing Tools

get.description: Get the default ingest profile for the account.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Authorization: Bearer access_token (see Getting Access Tokens)

401.description: NOT_AUTHORIZED: Credentials are required to access this resource

404.description: NOT_FOUND: The api couldn't find the resource you requested

post.description: Sets an ingest profile as the default for the account.

parameters.name: Set_Default_ProfileBody
parameters.description: Sets an ingest profile as the default for the account.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Authorization: Bearer access_token (see Getting Access Tokens)

400.description: BAD_REQUEST: The JSON was not valid

401.description: NOT_AUTHORIZED: Credentials are required to access this resource.

404.description: NOT_FOUND: The api couldn't find the resource you requested

409.description: CONFLICT: Account configuration already exists for 57838016001; please delete the configuration first, or update it instead.

put.description: Updates the default ingest profile for the account.

parameters.name: Update_Default_ProfileBody
parameters.description: Updates the default ingest profile for the account.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Authorization: Bearer access_token (see Getting Access Tokens)

400.description: BAD_REQUEST: The JSON was not valid

401.description: NOT_AUTHORIZED: Credentials are required to access this resource.

404.description: NOT_FOUND: The api couldn't find the resource you requested

409.description: CONFLICT: Account configuration already exists for 57838016001; please delete the configuration first, or update it instead.

post.description: Create a custom ingest profile for the account. Note that you can also do this through Video Cloud Studio

parameters.name: Create_Ingest_ProfileBody
parameters.description: Create a custom ingest profile for the account. Note that you can also do this through Video Cloud Studio

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Authorization: Bearer access_token (see Getting Access Tokens)

400.description: BAD_REQUEST: Invalid JSON — message varies according to the problem

401.description: NOT_AUTHORIZED: Credentials are required to access this resource.

409.description: CONFLICT: Could not create profile with this name and id (profile name or id already exists)

422.description: UNPROCESSABLE_ENTITY: required field missing — message varies according to the issue

get.description: Get an array of all the profiles valid for the account

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Authorization: Bearer access_token (see Getting Access Tokens)

401.description: NOT_AUTHORIZED: Credentials are required to access this resource.

404.description: NOT_FOUND:    Error 404 NOT_FOUND  HTTP ERROR 404 Problem accessing /v1/accounts/578380001/profiles. Reason

409.description: PROFILE_ERROR: profile rendition count exceeds configured rendition limit

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Authorization: Bearer access_token (see Getting Access Tokens)

401.description: NOT_AUTHORIZED: Credentials are required to access this resource.

get.description: Get a single profile map by its ID

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Authorization: Bearer access_token (see Getting Access Tokens)

401.description: NOT_AUTHORIZED: Credentials are required to access this resource.

404.description: NOT_FOUND:    Error 404 NOT_FOUND  HTTP ERROR 404 Problem accessing /v1/accounts/578380001/profiles. Reason

put.description: Update an existing ingest profile - the existing profile will be deactivated, and replaced by the one specified in the request body

parameters.name: Update_Ingest_ProfileBody
parameters.description: Update an existing ingest profile - the existing profile will be deactivated, and replaced by the one specified in the request body

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Authorization: Bearer access_token (see Getting Access Tokens)

400.description: BAD_REQUEST: Invalid JSON — message varies according to the problem

401.description: NOT_AUTHORIZED: Credentials are required to access this resource.

409.description: CONFLICT: Could not create profile with this name and id (profile name or id already exists)

422.description: UNPROCESSABLE_ENTITY: required field missing — message varies according to the issue

default_live_profile_id.description: default profile name for live streams

date_created.description: when the profile was created (epoch time in milliseconds)

date_last_modified.description: when the profile was last modified (epoch time in milliseconds)

max_profile_count.description: maximum number of custom profiles for the account

max_rendition_count.description: maximum number of renditions per profile

default_profile_id.description: The id or name of the profile you want to set as the default

default_live_profile_id.description: The id or name of the live profile you want to set as the default
default profile name for live streams

date_created.description: when the profile was created (epoch time in milliseconds)

date_last_modified.description: when the profile was last modified (epoch time in milliseconds)

max_profile_count.description: maximum number of custom profiles for the account

max_rendition_count.description: maximum number of renditions per profile

id.description: the configuration id (if you don't have it, make a GET request to get it)

default_profile_id.description: The id or name of the profile you want to set as the default

default_live_profile_id.description: The id or name of the live profile you want to set as the default
default profile name for live streams

date_created.description: when the profile was created (epoch time in milliseconds)

date_last_modified.description: when the profile was last modified (epoch time in milliseconds)

max_profile_count.description: maximum number of custom profiles for the account

max_rendition_count.description: maximum number of renditions per profile

name.description: profile name (must be unique within the account)

dynamic_origin.description: specification for renditions and images - Dynamic Delivery and CAE profiles only

renditions.description: array of rendition maps Legacy Ingest only

packages.description: array of package maps for DRM (see Content Security) Legacy Ingest only

rendition.description: rendition to use as master - either passthrough (the source optimized for online delivery) or none if you do not want to archive a master

distribute.description: whether to make the master playable as a rendition by pushing it to the CDN(s)

renditions.description: names of audio and video renditions to include (audio only for CAE profiles) - see Standard Ingest Profiles - renditions for available renditions you can choose from

temporary_renditions.description: names of video renditions for Fast Publish (only for CAE profiles) - see Standard Ingest Profiles - renditions for available renditions you can choose from

images.description: array of image specifications for poster and thumbnail (if omitted, no images will be captured during ingestion)

dynamic_profile_options.description: Defines rendition options for CAE profiles only

label.description: the kind of image this will be

height.description: the height of the image in pixels

width.description: the width of the image in pixels

min_renditions.description: Minimum number of renditions to create for CAE profiles only

max_renditions.description: Maximum number of renditions to create for CAE profiles only

min_resolution.description: Defines the minimum resolution for for CAE profiles only renditions

max_resolution.description: Defines the maximum resolution for renditions for CAE profiles only

max_bitrate.description: Maximum bitrate for renditions in kbps for CAE profiles only

max_first_rendition_bitrate.description: Maximum bitrate for lowest bitrate rendition in kbps for CAE profiles only

max_frame_rate.description: Maximum framerate for renditions in fps for CAE profiles only

keyframe_rate.description: The number of keyframes per second for renditions (So a value of 0.5 would result in one keyframe every two seconds; a value of 3 would result in three keyframes per second) for CAE profiles only

select_baseline_profile_configuration.description: At least one rendition used in the profile will be baseline profile for CAE profiles only

height.description: Minimum height for renditions for CAE profiles only

width.description: Minimum width for renditions for CAE profiles only

height.description: Maximum height for renditions for CAE profiles only

width.description: Maximum width for renditions for CAE profiles only

aspect_mode.description: how to handle mismatch between source and rendition aspect ratio Legacy Ingest only

audio_bitrate.description: audio bitrate in kbps Legacy Ingest only

audio_channels.description: number of audio channels Legacy Ingest only

audio_codec.description: audio codec, e.g. aac Legacy Ingest only

max_aac_profile.description: max aaic profile - aac-lc is the recommended value Legacy Ingest only

constant_bitrate.description: whether to use constant bitrate for encoding Legacy Ingest only

crf.description: 1-51, not used by default. Legacy Ingest only

decoder_bitrate_cap.description: In kbps, the max bitrate fed to the decoder Legacy Ingest only

encryption_method.description: encryption_method to use, e.g. aes-128 Legacy Ingest only

encryption_key_rotation_period.description: use a different key for each set of segments, rotating to a new key after this many segments Legacy Ingest only

fixed_keyframe_interval.description: Forces a keyframe every X frames, but still allows additional keyframes — NOTE overrides keyframe_interval Legacy Ingest only

forced_keyframe_rate.description: Force the keyframe rate, h264 only, ignored if forced_keyframe_interval is used Legacy Ingest only

format.description: video format, e.g. mp4, ts (for HLS), flv, m4f for video, png or jpg for images Legacy Ingest only

frame_rate.description: frame rate in frames per second Legacy Ingest only

h264_bframes.description: number of bframes for h.264 Legacy Ingest only

h264_level.description: h.264 profile level Legacy Ingest only

h264_reference_frames.description: number of h.264 reference frames to use Legacy Ingest only

hls_optimized_ts.description: Time segments optimized for HLS Legacy Ingest only

keyframe_interval.description: Maximum number of frames between keyframes (default is 250, and overrides keyframe_rate) Legacy Ingest only

keyframe_rate.description: Maximum number of keyframes per second Legacy Ingest only

label.description: Image type for image renditions; required for image renditions Legacy Ingest only

live_stream.description: Whether this will be for live streaming video Legacy Ingest only

live_sliding_window_duration.description: Duration of stream to keep available for LiveDVR delivery (in seconds) Legacy Ingest only

max_video_bitrate.description: Maximum video bitrate (h.264 only) Legacy Ingest only

max_frame_rate.description: Limits the frame rate rather than sets it, use as an alternative to frame rate Legacy Ingest only

media_type.description: the media type of the rendition Legacy Ingest only

one_pass.description: force one-pass encoding Legacy Ingest only

reference_id.description: A reference id for the rendition that is unique within the account - required for DRM packaging Legacy Ingest only

segment_seconds.description: number of seconds of content to include in segments (the default for HLS is 10; for DASH: 2) Legacy Ingest only

skip.description: A set of conditions for skippiung creation of this rendition see Conditional Output Legacy Ingest only

skip_video.description: Set to true to skip video encoding for audio-only renditions Legacy Ingest only

speed.description: a target transcoding speed. Slower transcoding allows for more advanced file compression, while faster transcoding is possible by skipping some advanced compression features Legacy Ingest only

streaming_delivery_format.description: Sets the format/protocol for an output that will be delivered using a specific streaming configuration, including necessary manifests, directory Legacy Ingest only

streaming_delivery_profile.description: Sets the profile of the streaming delivery format, ensuring options are selected for compatibility with the profile Legacy Ingest only

type.description: transmuxing type for HLS; typical value is segmented Legacy Ingest only

upscale.description: whether to upsize the frames if the source frame size is smaller than the target Legacy Ingest only

video_bitrate.description: target video bitrate in kbps Legacy Ingest only

video_codec.description: target video codec Legacy Ingest only

height.description: target frame height in pixels Legacy Ingest only

width.description: target frame width in pixels Legacy Ingest only

watermarks.description: array of watermark maps Legacy Ingest only

min_audio_bitrate.description: the minimum audio bitrate that the source must have (kbps) Legacy Ingest only

max_audio_bitrate.description: the maximum audio bitrate that the source must have (kbps) Legacy Ingest only

min_video_bitrate.description: the minimum video bitrate that the source must have (kbps) Legacy Ingest only

max_video_bitrate.description: the maximum video bitrate that the source must have (kbps) Legacy Ingest only

require_audio.description: if true the source must include an audio track Legacy Ingest only

require_video.description: if true the source must include a video track Legacy Ingest only

min_size.description: the source must be at least this resolution - string of the form "widthxheight" (e.g. "400x225") Legacy Ingest only

max_size.description: the source must be at most this resolution - string of the form "widthxheight" (e.g. "1920x1080") Legacy Ingest only

url.description: URL for the watermark image Legacy Ingest only

width.description: width in pixels or percent of frame width; e.g. 20 or 10% - decimal values like 10.5% are not permitted Legacy Ingest only

height.description: height in pixels or percent of frame width; e.g. 20 or 10% - decimal values like 10.5% are not permitted Legacy Ingest only

x.description: distance from left edge to center of image as pixels or precent of frame width; e.g. 20 or 10% (use negative values like -10 to position the watermark relative to the right edge) - decimal values like 10.5% are not permitted Legacy Ingest only

y.description: distance from top edge to center if image as pixels or percent of frame height; e.g. 20 or 10% (use negative values like -10 to position the watermark relative to the bottom edge) - decimal values like 10.5% are not permitted Legacy Ingest only

drm.description: for MPEG-DASH, array of DRM types to apply, e.g. ["widevine", "playready"] Legacy Ingest only

package_type.description: for MPEG-DASH, the package type is dash; for other formats, the package type is the DRM type, e.g. widevine Legacy Ingest only

renditions.description: for MPEG-DASH, the renditions will be set to the reference_id for a single rendition; for other formats, renditions is set equal to an array of rendition reference_id's Legacy Ingest only

date_created.description: when the profile was created (epoch time in milliseconds)

date_last_modified.description: when the profile was last modified (epoch time in milliseconds)

packages.description: array of package maps for DRM (see Content Security)

rendition.description: rendition that will be used as master (passthrough = source optimized for online delivery)

distribute.description: whether source is available for playback as a rendition

renditions.description: audio and video renditions to be created

images.description: specification for poster and thumbnail images

dynamic_profile_options.description: defines rendition options for CAE profiles

min-resolution.description: defines the minimum resolution for renditions

max-resolution.description: defines the maximum resolution for renditions

max_first_rendition_bitrate.description: maximum bitrate for the lowest bitrate rendition

keyframe_rate.description: keyframes per second for the renditions

select_baseline_profile_configuration.description: whether at least one rendition used in the profile will be baseline profile

width.description: defines the minimum width for renditions

height.description: defines the minimum height for renditions

width.description: defines the maximum width for renditions

height.description: defines the maximum height for renditions

aspect_mode.description: how to handle mismatch between source and rendition aspect ratio

constant_bitrate.description: whether to use constant bitrate for encoding — this field is not relevant for h.264 video and will be ignored

decoder_bitrate_cap.description: In kbps, the max bitrate fed to the decoder

encryption_key_rotation_period.description: use a different key for each set of segments, rotating to a new key after this many segments

fixed_keyframe_interval.description: Forces a keyframe every X frames, but still allows additional keyframes

forced_keyframe_rate.description: Force the keyframe rate, h264 only, ignored if forced_keyframe_interval is used

format.description: video format, e.g. mp4, ts (for HLS), flv, m4f for video, png or jpg for images

frame_rate.description: frame rate in frames per second

h264_reference_frames.description: number of h.264 reference frames to use

keyframe_interval.description: Maximum number of frames between keyframes (default is 250, and overrides keyframe_rate)

keyframe_rate.description: Maximum number of keyframes per second

label.description: Image type for image renditions; required for image renditions

live_stream.description: Whether this will be for live streaming video

live_sliding_window_duration.description: Duration of stream to keep available for LiveDVR delivery (in seconds)

max_frame_rate.description: Limits the frame rate rather than sets it, use as an alternative to frame rate

media_type.description: the media type of the rendition

package_format.description: Creates a zip or tar file containing all the media files of an output, and uploads this single package rather than all the individual files

reference_id.description: A reference id for the rendition that is unique within the account - required for DRM packaging

skip.description: A set of conditions for skippiung creation of this rendition see Conditional Output

skip_video.description: Set to true to skip video encoding for audio-only renditions

speed.description: a target transcoding speed. Slower transcoding allows for more advanced file compression, while faster transcoding is possible by skipping some advanced compression features

streaming_delivery_format.description: Sets the format/protocol for an output that will be delivered using a specific streaming configuration, including necessary manifests, directory

streaming_delivery_profile.description: Sets the profile of the streaming delivery format, ensuring options are selected for compatibility with the profile

type.description: transmuxing type for HLS; typical value is segmented

upscale.description: whether to upsize the frames if the source frame size is smaller than the target

min_audio_bitrate.description: the minimum audio bitrate that the source must have (kbps)

max_audio_bitrate.description: the maximum audio bitrate that the source must have (kbps)

min_video_bitrate.description: the minimum video bitrate that the source must have (kbps)

max_video_bitrate.description: the maximum video bitrate that the source must have (kbps)

require_audio.description: if true the source must include an audio track

require_video.description: if true the source must include a video track

min_size.description: the source must be at least this resolution - string of the form "widthxheight" (e.g. "400x225")

max_size.description: the source must be at most this resolution - string of the form "widthxheight" (e.g. "1920x1080")

width.description: width in pixels or percent of frame width; e.g. 20 or 10%

height.description: height in pixels or percent of frame width; e.g. 20 or 10%

x.description: distance from left edge to center of image as pixels or precent of frame width; e.g. 20 or 10%

y.description: distance from top edge to center if image as pixels or percent of frame height; e.g. 20 or 10%

drm.description: for MPEG-DASH, array of DRM types to apply, e.g. ["widevine", "playready"]

package_type.description: for MPEG-DASH, the package type is dash; for other formats, the package type is the DRM type, e.g. widevine

renditions.description: for MPEG-DASH, the renditions will be set to the reference_id for a single rendition; for other formats, renditions is set equal to an array of rendition reference_id's

date_created.description: when the profile was created (epoch time in milliseconds)

date_last_modified.description: when the profile was last modified (epoch time in milliseconds)

packages.description: array of package maps for DRM (see Content Security)

images.description: array of image specifications for poster and thumbnail (if omitted, no images will be captured during ingestion)
